questions.answer_description:
Saving the Last Core to Bootflash
This last core dump is automatically saved to bootflash in the /mnt/pss/ partition before the switchover or reboot occurs. Three minutes after the supervisor module reboots, the saved last core is restored from the flash partition (/mnt/pss) back to its original RAM location. This restoration is a background process and is not visible to the user.
Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/mds9000/sw/6_2/configuration/guides/system_management/nx-os/sysmgmt_cli_6-x/ sys.html#37039
questions.question_text:
A Cisco MDS 9000 Series Storage Switch has reloaded unexpectedly.
Where does the engineer look for the latest core dump file?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the one!

last core dump is automatically saved to bootflash in the /mnt/pss/ partition before the switchover or reboot occurs. Three minutes after the supervisor module reboots, the saved last core is restored from the flash partition (/mnt/pss) back to its original RAM location. This restoration is a background process and is not visible to the user.

It's a little tricky, I had to read it a few times but the correct answer is indeed D. While you have multiple zones consisting of FC vHBAs and storage target wwpns for SAN Fabrics A and B, you are ultimately booting off of the same boot LUN. Multiple paths to get to the same boot device which correspond with the same LUN ID.

Selected Answer: B
I choose B

Selected Answer: B
B. Create a SAN boot policy in which every initiator is mapped to a different target LUN.

 Recommended by Cisco: This is the safest and most scalable approach because:
 Each server has its own dedicated LUN, ensuring isolation and avoiding conflicts.
 Mapping initiators to unique LUNs is considered a best practice for SAN boot environments to prevent any possibility of corruption or boot issues.
 Enterprise deployments generally prefer this method because it provides precise control over boot resources.

Selected Answer: D
This configuration is typically used for SAN boot in Cisco UCS environments to provide consistency across multiple servers

choices.C: Define the vHBAs as bootable and leave the default values on the boot target definition.
choices.A: Define the vHBAs as bootable and leave the boot target definition empty.
choices.B: Create a SAN boot policy in which every initiator is mapped to a different target LUN.
choices.D: Create a SAN boot policy in which every initiator is mapped to the same target LUN.

questions.question_text:
An engineer must implement a Cisco UCS system at a customer site. One of the requirements is to implement SAN boot. The storage system maps the source
WWPN to a unique LUN.
Which method does Cisco recommend to configure the SAN boot?

questions.answer_description:
By default, trunk mode is enabled in all Fibre Channel interfaces. However, trunk mode configuration takes effect only in E-port mode. You can configure trunk mode as on (enabled), off (disabled), or auto (automatic). The default trunk mode is on. The trunk mode configuration at the two ends of an ISL, between two switches, determine the trunking state of the link and the port modes at both ends (see Table 15-1).

Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/storage/san_switches/mds9000/sw/rel_3_x/configuration/guides/cli_3_2/trnk.html
questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which feature set must be used to configure on switch 2 to establish a VSAN trunk between switch 1 and switch 2?
A.
✑ F Port
✑ Trunk Mode Passive
B.
✑ N Port
✑ Trunk Mode Active
C.
✑ NP Port
✑ Trunk Mode Auto
D.
✑ E Port
✑ Trunk Mode On

choices.A: fcdomain fcid database vsan 120 wwn 33:e8:00:05:30:00:16:df fcid 0x070128 fcdomain fcid persistent vsan 120
choices.D: ysan 120 wwn 33:e8:00:05:30:00:16:df fcid 0x070128 fcdomain fcid preserve vsan 120
choices.B: fabric-binding database vsan 120 vsan 120 wwn 33:e8:00:05:30:00:16:df fcid 0x070128
choices.C: vsan 120 wwn 33:e8:00:05:30:00:16:df fcid 0x070128 fabric-binding activate vsan 120 purge fcdomain fcid vsan 4

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct!

A is correct:
switch# config t
switch(config)# fcdomain fcid database
switch(config-fcid-db)# vsan 1000 wwn 33:e8:00:05:30:00:16:df fcid 0x070128

switch# config t
switch(config)# fcdomain fcid persistent vsan 1000

None of these are entirely complete. 
Correct response will be to enable the feature: fcdomain fcid persistent vsan xxx 
then set the static binding.: vsan xxx wwn xxx fcid 0x0xxx 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/mds9000/sw/5_2/configuration/guides/sysmgnt/nx-os/sysmgmt_cli/domn.html#67697

questions.question_text:
An engineer is performing a configuration on a Cisco Nexus 5000 Series Switch. The requirement is for the current Fibre Channel IDs in VSAN 120 to be saved across reboots. The Cisco environment also must integrate with a third-party solution that requires persistent Fibre Channel IDs for the VSAN. The WWN of the
Cisco switch must be 33:e8:00:05:30:00:16:df and its Fibre Channel ID 0x070128. Which command set meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
N9K-A and N9K-B are sharing the domain id of the core switches, which indicates they're acting as NPV devices. Their uplink to the core switches must be configured using the command "switchport mode NP".

Selected Answer: B
b is correct!

choices.A: N9K-A(config)# feature-set fcoe-npv N9K-A(config)# interface vfc-port-channel 100 N9K-A(config-if)# switchport mode E N9K-A(config-if)# switchport trunk allowed vsan 1, 20
choices.C: N9K-A(config)# feature fcoe N9K-A(config)# feature npv N9K-A(config)# interface vfc 100 N9K-A(config-if)# bind interface port-channel 100 N9K-A(config-if)# switchport mode N N9K-A(config-if)# switchport trunk allowed vsan 1, 20
choices.B: N9K-A(config)# feature-set fcoe-npv N9K-A(config)# interface vfc-port-channel 100 N9K-A(config-if)# switchport mode NP N9K-A(config-if)# switchport trunk allowed vsan 20
choices.D: N9K-A(config)# feature fcoe N9K-A(config)# feature npv N9K-A(config)# interface vfc 100 N9K-A(config-if)# bind interface port-channel 100 N9K-A(config-if)# switchport mode F N9K-A(config-if)# switchport trunk allowed vsan 20

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must configure FCoE between the N9K-A switch and the FCF-A Nexus 9000 core switch. The deployment has these characteristics:
✑ The N9K-A and N9K-B top-of-rack switches share the domain ID of the core switches.
✑ The hosts are equipped with converged network adapters.
✑ The only VSAN that is used is permitted to traverse port-channel 100 is VSAN 20.
Which configuration completes the FCoE configuration on the N9K-A device?
